alternative_title: Paying less or no import VAT and duty
body:
$!Duty relief schemes allow you to pay less or no duty on imports and exports from and to non-EU countries.$!

If you are importing or exporting in the EU, you won't have to pay any duty.

## Trading outside the EU
Where the EU has a Free Trade Agreement in place with another country you can claim relief through a 'trade preference' to pay less or no duty and VAT.

There are rules around [eligibility for trade preferences.](/specialist/importing-and-exporting-using-international-trade-preferences "Eligibility for trade preferences")

The rate of duty and the relief depends on the:

 - type of goods
 - country the goods are being exported to 
 - country the goods came from as set by the [‘rules of origin’](/specialist/rules-of-origin "Rules of origin")

To claim a trade preference you need to:

- get the correct [commodity code](/finding-commodity-codes "Commodity codes") for your goods
- make sure your goods comply with the [rules of origin](/specialist/rules-of-origin "Rules of origin")
- be able to provide [proof of where your goods came from](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageVAT_ShowContent&propertyType=document&columns=1&id=HMCE_CL_001189 "(Import preferences (Proof of preferential origin)"){:rel="external"}
- make sure you comply with [transport rules](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/ipgnmanual/IPGN2250.htm "The transport rule"){:rel="external"}

$C
**HM Revenue & Customs helpline:**  
0845 010 9000
$C


##Other duty relief schemes

If you're importing from or exporting to a country where there is no Free Trade Agreement in place with the EU, you might be able to apply for one of these relief schemes:

- [temporary admission](/specialist/temporary-admission "Temporary admission") if you import goods for a limited time, eg for an exhibition  
- [Inward Processing](/specialist/inward-processing "Inward processing scheme") for goods imported from outside the EU, worked on in the EU and then exported to another non-EU country 
- [Outward Processing](/specialist/outward-processing-relief-opr "Outward processing scheme") (including textiles) for goods that are temporarily exported to a non-EU country, eg for repair 
- [customs warehousing](/specialist/customs-warehousing "Customs warehousing") when you move goods between duty free warehouses 
- the [community system of duty relief](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageImport_InfoGuides&propertyType=document&id=HMCE_CL_001183 "community system for duty relief"){:rel="external"} for goods that promote culture and science 
- [duty suspensions and tariff quotas](/specialist/duty-suspensions-and-tariff-quotas "Duty suspensions and tariff quotas") for raw materials, parts or half-finished products 
- [returned goods relief](http://customs.hmrc.gov.uk/channelsPortalWebApp/channelsPortalWebApp.portal?_nfpb=true&_pageLabel=pageLibrary_ShowContent&id=HMCE_CL_000226&propertyType=document "returned goods relief"){:rel="external"} for goods you reimport  
- [end-use-relief](/specialist/end-use-relief "End use relief") for certain goods like fish or cheese 
- [processing under customs control](/specialist/processing-under-customs-control-pcc "Processing under customs control") for raw materials

*[EU]: European Union
overview: Schemes that offer reduced or zero rate duty and VAT for imports and exports
title: Duty relief for imports and exports
